derivation: a primitive root; properly, to be bright; i.e. (by implication)
outline:
1. to be clean, be pure
    1. (Qal)
      1. to be clean (physically - of disease)
      2. to be clean ceremonially
      3. to purify, be clean morally, made clean
    2. (Piel)
      1. to cleanse, purify
        1. physically
        2. ceremonially
        3. morally
      2. to pronounce clean
      3. to perform the ceremony of cleansing
    3. (Pual) to be cleansed, be pronounced clean
    4. (Hithpael)
      1. to purify oneself
        1. ceremonially
        2. morally
      2. to present oneself for purification
kjv_def: be (make, make self, pronounce) clean, cleanse (self), purge, purify(-ier, self).
strongs_def: to be pure (physical sound, clear, unadulterated; Levitically, uncontaminated; morally, innocent or holy)
